item.description:
Here's an odd twist on the Sweetheart theme: The Theatre@First Community theater in Somerville is putting on a performance of Dracula over the next few weekends. It is NOT the traditional story.

http://www.theatreatf...

The theater is the Elizabeth Peabody house, located at 277 Broadway in Somerville. A note about parking. Somerville has instituted citywide permit parking on all streets, with the exception of main streets like Broadway. However, there is a parking lot nearby where a Shaws used to be. That may be free to use. You can also take the Orange Line to Sullivan Square and then the 101 bus along Broadway.

As pointed out by fellow member Laurie, groups of 10 or more qualify for discounts on tickets. Individual tickets go for $15. I spoke with the director of this production and he said that the theater is pretty small (seats about 70 people).

Update: I spoke to the House Manager at Theatre@First. He said the group discount is $2/ticket. I have made a non-binding reservation for 15 tickets at that price so far.

Update 2 I spoke to the director again. For those who are interested to know more about how this production of Dracula differs from Bram Stoker's original, this is what he said:

- The characters of Lucy and Mina are reversed for the most part (Lucy
is engaged to Jonathan. Mina is engaged to Arthur.) I haven't the
slightest idea why the author did that.

- Lucy is the sole reason Dracula is coming to England, rather than
the idea that he is simply looking for new feeding grounds.

- The character of Quincy Morris isn't in this version (which is a
shame, because he's one of my favorite characters).

- The tone is, by necessity, somewhat different. The novel is more of
a suspense story. The play is more of an adventure story with
elements of comedy.

Apparently, these last few shows are selling well. So, if all maybes want to come, please change your RSVP to yes soon so I can reserve more tickets.

I, Jason, am about 6 ft with a thin build, thinning hair and glasses. I will be in front of the theater at 7:30 PM with a shirt that reads:

"I shall have to invent a new classification of a lunatic for you."

For those that want to get together after for a drink or a bite, there are a few eating/drinking establishments in the area.
